text.p: Following are the main stories in Thursday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Tenaga Nasional Bhd will make a "goodwill" payment by way of a 10 percent rebate to its 4.2 million users affected by the Aug. 3 blackout.
- Showing his seriousness in combating corruption, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad appeared in Parliament today to answer questions on money politics.
- The Cabinet has no objection to the staging of Michael Jackson's concert, Culture, Arts and Tourism Minister Sabbaruddin Chik said on Wednesday.
- Malaysia recorded an external trade surplus of 600.7 million ringgit in August compared with a deficit of 614.966 million in July.
- Ahmad Sarji Abdul Hamid has been appointed chairman of Permodalan Nasional Bhd, replacing Ismail Ali at the helm of the Bumiputera (ethnic Malay) investment agency.

- A Royal Malaysian Airforce helicopter with six crewmen and an injured Thai sailor who had just been airlifted, crashed at sea about 44 nautical miles off Muka Head, Teluk Bahang, in Penang last night.
